script: Only Cindy Berman would expect to clean the outhouse and not get dirty.

Mary… she tried to kill him.

We know where the body is, so all we need is the hand.
Is it still buried under the Hanging Tree?

We're going to lose her. We're going to lose both.
Don't go wobbly on me now, Henry.
Luck and a very sharp knife.

First his child, then his wife. He needs someone to take care of him.

I worry about you. Is it so wrong for a father to wish his daughter to wed?
And leave you alone to eat up all the bacon?

Good night to enjoy the fruits of the land.

Aren't you even a little curious?
I'll only go if you go.
Girl, what's taking so long? I need help with… Get inside.
I can see a secret about you, girl.
And a good day to you, Thomas.
Don't you want to hear it, pretty girl?
I see all the dark secrets in Union.
I see the darkness in you, girl!
It's too much. I can't accept it.
We're practically married. Haven't you heard?
Well, in that case, tell your father this isn't nearly worth it.
Shadows fall on us all now and then.
My, uh… My brother wants me to give up.
He says the Goode family are not farmers.
But these lands, they are fertile. I know it.
We'll have a healthy crop yet.
The sun will shine on us.
Well, I'm going to lose light.
Nothing good comes from those woods after sundown.
Shouldn't you be sleeping? Father wouldn't approve.
She drinks the blood of virgins to keep her youth.
She sacrificed her husband to become the Devil's bride.
That's how she gained eternal life.
Well, I heard she kept the company of the natives, and that she even fell in love with one.
She learned their medicine too. Solomon told me.
He took his wife to her after they lost their child, but it was too late.
Are you sure this is the right way? How do you know where we're going?
I've been there before. Remember when Abigail had her ring of fire?
She was scratching like a dog during Father's sermon.
Mother told me she'd lain with a demon.
Well, whoever she lay with, Abbi made me go to the widow with her.
-And the widow fixed her with witchcraft? -Yes, witchcraft.
And some foul-smelling paste made for whores like Abbi Berman.
The veil has grown thin with the turn of the moon.
And with it, the Morning Star rises.
Beware the Devil. He lives in that book.
He calls to you from it.
And if you're not careful, he'll bore himself beneath your skin and he'll consume you from the inside out.
To the fruits of the land.
Sarah Fier, you want a kiss too?
You know, maybe if you weren't such a frigid bitch-- And if you're still so eager, I'm sure there's a mule tied up who will overlook your flaws in the dark.
I'm just not afraid with you.
Tell me to stop and I shall.
What if it was the widow or Caleb?
Caleb can barely find his own member.
But if he saw us, if he tells-- That spoiled piglet doesn't scare me.
Well, let them hang us then.
I was not alive before now anyway.
You've overslept. I've done most of the morning work.
There's something wrong with my father.
To be freed, to be released.
He's distracted, listening to things only he can hear.
I look in his eyes and it's as if… As if something crawled in from the night and put on Father's skin.
It looks like him, but… Mother's gone to the meeting house.
She says we must ask God, but I don't know which Psalm, what passage-- He needs proper medicine, Hannah.
She can't know you were here.
I'm not to see you anymore.
Do you think… Did we cause it?
You won't stop until you've completely ruined her life, will you?
Thomas saw you last night in town!
He's telling everyone! How dare you bring this filth into our home!
I see what you really are, girl.
God knows what you are, girl!
You'd better pray for mercy on your damned soul!
I heard you come home late last night.
You were out with the pastor's daughter, weren't you?
You know, it was your mother who convinced us to settle this land.
She was wise enough to understand this land was special.
She said she could feel it in the air.
So we put down roots… and made up our own Eden here.
And I fear in her absence… I have failed her.
Father… There has always been a strangeness in you, Sarah.
A streak… Something perhaps a mother could have rooted out, but you were raised like a boy.
I gave you too much freedom, and now it is too late.
to harvest the bitter fruit of the evil we have sown.
blind to the horrors around us.
But you see it now, don't you?
He blocks our well, clogs it with our sin.
He takes our water. He takes our life blood!
-What's going on here? -The bucket's caught on something.
A dead dog in the well!
This is the work of the Devil. He has come to stake our land.
Who among you has welcomed the Devil to Union?
The Devil has come and cast his darkness over us.
And his darkness grows within each of us like a rot.
Solomon… I didn't mean to stop by unexpected.
I have just a, uh… a small thank you.
And that's when I saw something in the trees.
I don't know. It was so dark.
I thought it was Caleb or… or the widow.
Now we are tormented and the pastor is sick and… and I feel half mad, and now I wonder if perhaps something is wrong with me.
I was never normal. My own father said so.
Maybe I was born wicked and strange.
Maybe it was the Devil in the woods.
Maybe the Devil is in me.
Stop! You sound like Mad Thomas.
Thomas is a mindless drunk, nothing more.
Look around, Solomon. There is blight everywhere.
I… I… I grant you that, but you… Hannah was just a dalliance, Sarah.
Listen to me… Dalliance or not… one does not summon the Devil by chance.
Even the weakest heart, the most corruptible soul, they must make the choice.
They must extend their hand, which you did not do.
You can always come to me, Sarah.
My door is always open to you.
He's locked the children in the Meeting House. A dozen at least.
-Let me go! Let me go! Cyrus! -Constance!
and evil force at work here.
If we are ever to end this misery… Aye!
…then we must root out the guilty.
Our pastor was a man of God.
My child, my dear Constance, and many others… are dead.
…many of our entire bloodlines have been stolen from us.
I saw some little lambs of our town… laughing, dallying on the full moon last!
There were some of us in the woods, but there was no… We drank Apple Jack. We danced.
We are young. That is not a crime!
You have sinned! You have sinned!
For they will bear the Devil's mark!
But just as my brother Solomon heroically expelled the darkness among us by killing our afflicted pastor, we too will punish and surmount this evil!
As survivors, our faces always will remain toward the sun.
This scourge centers on Union proper.
I've searched the woods. It does not extend beyond the settlement.
We are being punished, and I have a list of names!
Oh, then show it to us! Show it to us!
I ask… do you have proof?
It was some nights back when the full moon had risen just beside the sun.
As I lay sleeping, she came to me.
She witched me and led me to the woods.
She was naked… …and riding a red mule.
And she made me watch as she lay with the Devil.
As both of them lay with the Devil.
I saw Hannah Miller and Sarah Fier.
-I saw Sarah Fier. -I saw Sarah Fier.
-We need to get away from here! -And go where?
We will not rest and we will not have mercy!
-Father! -My fault… Did you hear that? The other side of the house.
Take your musket round back to the Fier house.
Keep an eye on George Fier.
Keep an eye out for that witch.
I am to hang on the morrow.
And if you don't flee, you will too.
That is not how it works. You do not summon the Devil by chance.
You have to make a choice.
It doesn't matter if we did it or not.
They think we're guilty, so we are.
So what difference does it make if we do now?
-What are you saying? -I will go back to the widow.
I will make a deal with the Devil.
But the Devil… Are you mad?
Hannah, I fear the neighbor who would accuse me.
I fear the mother that would let her daughter hang.
They lead us like lambs to the slaughter and expect us to just follow.
Well, they will see… I am no lamb.
When this is over, we will leave this place.
We will go far away and we'll dance every night, then kiss in the broad daylight.
If they want a witch… I will give them a witch.
-Elijah, I said enough! -Please, you have to help me!
-We're innocent, Solomon. -I know… Hannah and I, we didn't do this!
-You're bleeding. -It doesn't matter. Listen to me.
I went back to the woods, to the widow.
And there was this… this book… with a… a kind of instruction, an incantation.
I think someone struck a deal with the Devil.
Solomon, I swear it… it wasn't me!
There's no one here but me.
Do not try to intimidate me, Caleb. I am not some child!
What's in the back room, Solomon?
What do you have to hide?
I'll tell you once more. There's no one here, but me.
Samael… Lucifer… Gorgon… Morning Star… It's you.
Only I've grown tired of watching fortune turn a blind eye to me.
How could I what? Take what we all want?
What we all came here for?
Consider, Sarah… a single soul… Cyrus Miller.
what no amount of praying could ever bring.
One person every few years seems a small price to pay.
Your neighbors hunt you, forsake you, curse your name!
Yet you resign yourself to it!
They're afraid because they know you're different.
Someone who refuses to settle for the rules of these dogmatists, who seeks more from the world.

Stop fighting! I don't want to hurt-- No!
Confess your sins or burn in eternal hell.

I will never… let you go.

now that we know the truth, now we know about Goode's deal… …what happens now?

for rescuing poor helpless Shadysider me!
